utils.agent.factorized_action_distributions.Categorical

class utils.agent.factorized_action_distributions.Categorical(inputs: List[Union[numpy.array, tf.Tensor, torch.Tensor]], model: ray.rllib.models.modelv2.ModelV2)

Bases: ray.rllib.models.tf.tf_action_dist.TFActionDistribution

Categorical distribution for discrete action spaces.

__init__(inputs: List[Union[numpy.array, tf.Tensor, torch.Tensor]], model: ray.rllib.models.modelv2.ModelV2)

Initializes an ActionDist object.

Parameters

  • inputs – input vector to compute samples from.

  • model (ModelV2) – reference to model producing the inputs. This is mainly useful if you want to use model variables to compute action outputs (i.e., for auto-regressive action distributions, see examples/autoregressive_action_dist.py).

Methods

__init__(inputs, model)

Initializes an ActionDist object.

deterministic_sample()

Sample an action from the distribution by

entropy()

Calculate the entropy of the distribution.

kl(other)

Calculate the KL divergence between this distribution and the other.

logp(x)

Calculate the log probability of the given action.

multi_entropy()

The entropy of the action distribution.

multi_kl(other)

The KL-divergence between two action distributions.

required_model_output_shape(action_space, ...)

Calculate the required model output shape for the given action space.

sample()

Draw a sample from the action distribution.

sampled_action_logp()

Returns the log probability of the sampled action.
deterministic_sample() → Union[numpy.array, tf.Tensor, torch.Tensor]
Sample an action from the distribution by

taking the argmax of the logits.

Returns

Action.
